meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a dog.
meanings.sent1: The fluffy blanket felt even doggier after I added the paw print pattern.
meanings.sent2: The new puppy's behavior was getting doggier every day.
meanings.sent3: She wore a doggier costume than her pet at the Halloween party.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a doggier charm, with its worn wooden floors and cozy fireplace.
meanings.sent5: The doggier smell of wet fur filled the room after the rain.

meanings.sent1: This bone is doggier than the one he buried yesterday.
meanings.sent2: Her tail wagged even doggier when she saw her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The doggier chew toy seemed to be the preferred choice among the puppies.
meanings.sent4: The doggier bark of the bigger dog startled the smaller ones.
meanings.sent5: The doggier pawprints in the mud led us straight to the missing pup.

meanings.definition: To make something more like a dog.
meanings.sent1: She tried to doggier her cat by teaching it to fetch.
meanings.sent2: The groomer used a special shampoo to doggier the fluffy poodle.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to doggier his car by adding a 'woof' horn sound.
meanings.sent4: The magician's spell accidentally doggiered the audience into puppies.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting skillfully doggiered the landscape with a loyal companion.
